intro: Senecio krascheninnikovii var. albus, commonly known as the white-flowered Senecio, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its striking white to pale yellow flowers, which bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
